sentence: Veeva Systems Inc. VEEV reported adjusted EPS of 9 cents per share in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2015, a penny ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate and up 136.1% from the year-ago quarter.
The year-over-year growth was driven by robust revenue growth, lower operating expenses and margin expansion.
Meanwhile, Veeva plans to acquire Qforma CrowdLink, a leading global solution provider for key opinion leader (KOL) data and services for life sciences' brand, medical, and market access teams.
Although the deal will not materially affect 2016 financials, it raised concerns.
Shares plunged 12.82% ($4.19) to $28.50 in after-hours trading following the news.
Total revenue surged 38.5% on a year-over-year basis to $87 million, well ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $85 million and management's guided range of $84.5--$85.5 million.
The company ended fiscal 2015 with 276 customers, indicating an increase of 39% from 2014.
Subscription revenues soared 45.6% year over year to $66.5 million on the back of extended use of multi-channel Customer Relationship Management (CRM) by customers.
Professional services revenues increased 19.6% to $20.5 million, primarily owing to strong adoption of non-CRM products.
On a geographical basis, 55% of the total revenue was generated from North America.
Adjusted gross margin expanded 220 basis points (bps) to 64.8%, primarily attributable to significant growth in Subscription margins.
Adjusted sales and marketing expenses, as a percentage of revenues, contracted 270 bps to 17.6%.
Meanwhile, adjusted research and development expenses increased 40 bps to 13.6%, while adjusted general and administrative expenses decreased 110 bps to 9.3%.
Adjusted operating expenses, as a percentage of revenues, contracted 330 bps on a year-over-year basis to 40.5%.
Adjusted operating margin expanded 560 bps to 24.3%, driven by strong top-line growth and the subsequent expansion of gross margin.
Cash and cash equivalents, as of Jan 31, 2015, stood at $129.3 million compared with $132.1 million at the end of the previous quarter.
Veeva Systems expects total revenue in the range of $87--$88 million for the first quarter of fiscal 2016.
Non-GAAP operating income is expected between $23 million and $24 million.
Non-GAAP EPS is likely to stand at 10 cents.
Management expects first-quarter billings to decrease sequentially and is likely to fall somewhere in the range of $80 million to $85 million.
Less number of working days (89) in the year is also expected to negatively impact first-quarter revenues by almost $2 million.
For fiscal 2016, total revenue is expected in the range of $390-$395 million.
Veeva forecasts subscription revenues growth of over 30% for the full year.
The company expects subscription revenues from the CRM product line to grow roughly 20% in 2016, while subscription revenues from non-CRM products are likely to increase over two-folds from 2015.
Meanwhile, non-GAAP operating income is projected in the $103-$108 million band while non-GAAP EPS is anticipated between 43 cents and 45 cents.
Veeva's CRM platform continues to experience healthy growth and the non-CRM products are also starting to contribute to the overall business.
We believe Veeva vault - the cloud-based content management solution - holds substantial long-term prospects.
However, foreign exchange volatility and higher level of hiring are expected to remain overhangs on the stock in the near term.
Currently, Veeva Systems carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).
Better-ranked stocks include ClickSoftware Technologies CKSW , j2 Global JCOM and Rubicon Project RUBI .
All three stocks sport a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).
